text: Julio Camillo Bellache (May 1, 1836 in Paris – August 25, 1895 in Curitiba) was a businessman French-Brazilian.All Birth, Baptism & Christening results for Abderrezak Bellache Ancestry{name} na entrada para Rosina Bellache, “Brasil, Batismos, 1688–1935” Family Search Julio Camillo Belache was born in Paris, France, on May 1, 1836. He migrated to Brazil, where he married Austrian immigrant Katharina Johanna Francisca Sprenger, born on June 12, 1844, in Elmen, in the Tyrol region, Austria. Together they had four children: Carlos, Julio, Paulina and Rosina. He developed several commercial activities, owning a hardware store, a haberdashery and grocery store and a tannery. He was one of the directors of Curitiba Immigration Society. He died in Curitiba, on August 28, 1895. ==References== Category:1836 births Category:1895 deaths Category:19th-century French businesspeople Category:Brazilian businesspeople
title: Julio Camillo Bellache
